material.mattext:
Quiz 3 - Quaternions and exponential coordinates

This quiz covers Section 3.3-3.5 of the notes.

 Instructions

  • This quiz consists of 10 questions, covering content from the previous week.
  • You are allowed to submit the quiz an unlimited number of times with no time limit, and on each submission you can review each incorrect question attempt after the fact.
  • When reattempting the quiz, only the previously incorrect question(s) from the last attempted quiz will be available to attempt. The correct question(s) from the last attempted quiz will automatically be added to your score.

The following quaternion has a unit norm of 1:

$${\bf q} = [0.5 ~~ 0.5 ~~ 0.5 ~~ 0.5]^T$$
Determine the quaternion corresponding to a rotation angle of \(\alpha=\frac{\pi}{4}\) and a rotation vector of \(\hat{\bf v}=[\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} ~~ 0 ~~ -\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}]^T\).

Determine the quaternion equivalent of the following rotation matrix:

$${\bf R}=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0.00498 & 0.0995 & 0.995\\
0.0995 & 0.99 & -0.0995\\
-0.995 & 0.0995 & -0.00498
\end{array}\right]$$

Given the quaternion below, determine the large-angle axis-angle representation that describes the same orientation based on double cover.

$${\bf q}=\left[\begin{array}{cccc}
0.705 & 0.0705 & 0.705 & 0
\end{array}\right]^T$$

Determine the skew-symmetric matrix of the following vector:

$${\bf v}=\left[\begin{array}{cccc}
0.2 & 0.3 & 0.5
\end{array}\right]^T$$

Use Rodrigues formula to determine the rotation matrix corresponding to the exponential coordinates of

$$\alpha\hat{\bf v}=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0.5 & 0.5 & 0
\end{array}\right]^T.$$

Determine the rotation angle corresponding to a rotation matrix of the form

$${\bf R}=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0.995 & -0.0997 & -0.00499\\
0.0997 & 0.99 & 0.0997\\
-0.00499 & -0.0997 & 0.995
\end{array}\right].$$

Determine the skew-symmetric matrix form of \(\hat{\bf v}\) corresponding to a rotation matrix of 

$${\bf R}=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}
0.995 & -0.0997 & -0.00499\\
0.0997 & 0.99 & 0.0997\\
-0.00499 & -0.0997 & 0.995
\end{array}\right].$$

Determine the axis-angle representation required to rotate

$$\hat{\bf a}=[1~0~0]^T$$

to

$$\hat{\bf b}=[0~\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}~\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}]^T.$$

Determine the rotation matrix required to rotate

$$\hat{\bf a}=[1~0~0]^T$$

to

$$\hat{\bf b}=[0~\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}~\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}]^T.$$
